content: ernesto (or was it alberto?) Fujimory was a tyrant. Yes, he dealt a SERIOUS blow to the Tupac Amaru and te Sendero Luminoso (shining path), but he also imprisoned political dissentors, stole money like no other, assassinated opponents, and was a cog in the Coca business. the man actually did away with the Peruvian Constitution to assure his position as president of Peru. i hope he spends the rest of his natural life behind bars, or is executed for his deeds.

content: the government reserves increased with Fujimori from the real nothing, inserted the peruvian economy to the global one,payed to the IMF, built a lot os schools in all the territory,light ,water for poorest people, the ancient politic class lived and still, like kings,DEA fought with Fujimori, together,the two presidents before Fujimori, Belaunde was a blind man and denied the Intelligence Reports about a recent subversives in the Highland,(1979,80) Alan Garcia just robbed all the money, crush the country, new millionaires class appeared; politic class has an antique ideas, they get everything jus for them not for the people,Fujimori had to fight against them,changed everything,a Congress with two cameras, years for some new decret but nothing, efficiency was needing the country, not burocracy,people wanted changes for better ,so it happened.Fujimori started the actual bonanza in Peru;nobody got in prison, that is false or show it, say names ;now, all the people enjoy an increasing economy thanks Fujimori`s economic politics;he never installed a terror politic, no one can say that because never existed, if five persons died (students), they were terrorist, if a group of persons at a party was assasinated, ok, but they were terrorist members and recognize was an excess to kill them but.... was a little group of military tha acted out of law, that is the truth and they were sanctioned;so, I ask are you with the terrorism or with democracy;Shinig Path is a world alliance still live, would you like to be ruled by this groups? Juanjo11.

Juanjo11. i'll give him credit for trouncing the Sendero Luminoso. their leaders were idealists, and fought from the heart and not with drug money, nowadays, they are deep in bed with the Narcos, and funding their ressurgance with drug money. but Alberto's policies were too over reaching.. it is as if if Obama did away with congress and kept senate full of cronies. that is what Fujimori did. he got rid of one camara of representatives and staffed the other. it worked JUST LONG ENOUGH for the Peruvian currency to become strong again, and then he, and his camara members began to plunder it. (as evidenced by his extra 12 billion dollars found in his bank) he not only defrauded his peole, he defraudsed japanese investors and aid workers. as far as his death squads, "Grupo Colina", they were his armed forces, operating under his direct control, and thus he is responsible for any and all actions they commited remember... you can always delegate authority, but you can NEVER delegate responsability. his Auto Golpe was a measured act desighned to gain authoritative power over his people, and he exersized that authority with sanctions against the press.. under his rule freedom of press became threatened. Universities were redistributed to HIS pocket. he was so dangerous in the area, that Peru was ostracized form the OAS, and CHILE, ARGENTINA, and ECUADOR pulled their Ambassadors out... How about the detention and disappearance of the 67 students from Huancayo, and the disappearance of the residents from Chimbote? they all have names, and are all still missing... he has been found guilty and will spend the next 25 years in prison, ON TOP of his 6 years he was convicted to for corruption charges.

content: The point is, democracy versus terrorism, that´s all. A few days ago, soldiers were killed in Ayacucho emergency zone, what can you tell me about it? terrorism is still alive... and fighting...government reserves was full when Fujimori left the power...and MFI recognized that. why Elles say the contrary? Alan garcia stoled all the money.Never Argentina,Chile Ecuador left Peru falling down, That is false, why are you lying, Elles? where are you from? Are you a terrorist?..Maybe nobody knows but in peruvian jungle, war is a cruel reality and you know what? ong offices get officials and soldiers in trial.I mean, soldier John says his buddies..."... hey .wait for me, keep fighting, I have to go to declare to the court, I will be back soon..." that is because of the demands for suppose Abuse against the human rights of the terrorist, say anything Elleso...Fujimori changed the rules because peruvian politicians were blind men, they lived in clouds not on the earth so, the country never get up...Country was needing a change and Fujimori did it...ONGs office get money from the foreing countries but for terrorist legal defense and they are trying to disturb the war that the government is fighting, actually ,in the jungle and the highland;Actually,Peruvian Armed Forces are fighting while you are reading this forum...remember...only a blind man and the terrorists can say Fujimori stoled money, look at the country right now, is growing every day, Toledo continued the same economic line and Aln Garci does the same, you really think you can built a country in five years? if so, you are a magician that everybody woul like to have...Juanjo11...

Are you a terrorist?..Maybe nobody knows but in peruvian jungle, war is a cruel reality and you know what? ong offices get officials and soldiers in trial.I mean, soldier John says his buddies..."... hey .wait for me, keep fighting, I have to go to declare to the court, I will be back soon..." that is because of the demands for suppose Abuse against the human rights of the terrorist, say anything Elleso...Fujimori changed the rules because peruvian politicians were blind men, they lived in clouds not on the earth so, the country never get up...Country was needing a change and Fujimori did it...ONGs office get money from the foreing countries but for terrorist legal defense and they are trying to disturb the war that the government is fighting, actually ,in the jungle and the highland;Actually,Peruvian Armed Forces are fighting while you are reading this forum...remember...only a blind man and the terrorists can say Fujimori stoled money, look at the country right now, is growing every day, Toledo continued the same economic line and Aln Garci does the same, you really think you can built a country in five years? if so, you are a magician that everybody woul like to have...Juanjo11... i have been in the jungles of peru. i lived in Iquitos as a child (not making me an expert by any extent of the word) you ask where i am from... i am originary of the USA, but have lived all over the world. i lived in maracaibo, Venezuela, in Iquitos, in Mendoza Argentina. i Pretty much grew up in Mexico, i watched Alberto's rise to power as an adult. and i watched his fall from grace. the man got power, and became intoxicated with it. His head of intelligence was a filthy man. his actions reflected that of Alberto's needs. Montessino was a spy who was dishonorably discharged from the Peruvian Army. he spent time in prison for selling secrets to the USA. quote: Various states acted to condemn the coup individually. Venezuela broke off diplomatic relations, and Argentina withdrew its ambassador. Chile joined Argentina in requesting that Peru be suspended from the Organization of American States. International financiers delayed planned or projected loans, and the United States, Germany and Spain suspended all non-humanitarian aid to Peru. The coup appeared to threaten the economic recovery strategy of reinsertion, and complicated the process of clearing arrears with the International Monetary Fund. Whereas Peruvian-U.S. relations early in Fujimori's presidency had been dominated by questions of coca eradication, Fujimori's autogolpe immediately became a major obstacle to international relations, as the United States immediately suspended all military and economic aid to Peru, with exceptions for counter-narcotic and humanitarian-related funds. Two weeks after the self-coup, the George H.W. Bush administration changed its position and officially recognized Fujimori as the legitimate leader of Peru "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberto_Fujimori" i know this is wikkipedia, but it iwas a quick search. El Sendero luminoso has been resurging since the exodus of Fujimori. with one faction becomming a political organization (not unlike the PLO, or the IRA), and the other getting in bed with the FaRC in Colombia. remember, to you they are terrorists, to many in the jungles of Peru, they are "liberators" i guess it is just a matter of outlook.

content: the government reserves increased with Fujimori from the real nothing, inserted the peruvian economy to the global one,payed to the IMF, built a lot os schools in all the territory,light ,water for poorest people, the ancient politic class lived and still, like kings,DEA fought with Fujimori, together,the two presidents before Fujimori, Belaunde was a blind man and denied the Intelligence Reports about a recent subversives in the Highland,(1979,80) Alan Garcia just robbed all the money, crush the country, new millionaires class appeared; politic class has an antique ideas, they get everything jus for them not for the people,Fujimori had to fight against them,changed everything,a Congress with two cameras, years for some new decret but nothing, efficiency was needing the country, not burocracy,people wanted changes for better ,so it happened.Fujimori started the actual bonanza in Peru;nobody got in prison, that is false or show it, say names ;now, all the people enjoy an increasing economy thanks Fujimori`s economic politics;he never installed a terror politic, no one can say that because never existed, if five persons died (students), they were terrorist, if a group of persons at a party was assasinated, ok, but they were terrorist members and recognize was an excess to kill them but.... was a little group of military tha acted out of law, that is the truth and they were sanctioned;so, I ask are you with the terrorism or with democracy;Shinig Path is a world alliance still live, would you like to be ruled by this groups? Juanjo11.

title: fujimori guilty?

content: quote: Originally posted by juanjo11: the government reserves increased with Fujimori from the real nothing, inserted the peruvian economy to the global one,payed to the IMF, built a lot os schools in all the territory,light ,water for poorest people, the ancient politic class lived and still, like kings,DEA fought with Fujimori, together,the two presidents before Fujimori, Belaunde was a blind man and denied the Intelligence Reports about a recent subversives in the Highland,(1979,80) Alan Garcia just robbed all the money, crush the country, new millionaires class appeared; politic class has an antique ideas, they get everything jus for them not for the people,Fujimori had to fight against them,changed everything,a Congress with two cameras, years for some new decret but nothing, efficiency was needing the country, not burocracy,people wanted changes for better ,so it happened.Fujimori started the actual bonanza in Peru;nobody got in prison, that is false or show it, say names ;now, all the people enjoy an increasing economy thanks Fujimori`s economic politics;he never installed a terror politic, no one can say that because never existed, if five persons died (students), they were terrorist, if a group of persons at a party was assasinated, ok, but they were terrorist members and recognize was an excess to kill them but.... was a little group of military tha acted out of law, that is the truth and they were sanctioned;so, I ask are you with the terrorism or with democracy;Shinig Path is a world alliance still live, would you like to be ruled by this groups? Juanjo11. i'll give him credit for trouncing the Sendero Luminoso. their leaders were idealists, and fought from the heart and not with drug money, nowadays, they are deep in bed with the Narcos, and funding their ressurgance with drug money. but Alberto's policies were too over reaching.. it is as if if Obama did away with congress and kept senate full of cronies. that is what Fujimori did. he got rid of one camara of representatives and staffed the other. it worked JUST LONG ENOUGH for the Peruvian currency to become strong again, and then he, and his camara members began to plunder it. (as evidenced by his extra 12 billion dollars found in his bank) he not only defrauded his peole, he defraudsed japanese investors and aid workers. as far as his death squads, "Grupo Colina", they were his armed forces, operating under his direct control, and thus he is responsible for any and all actions they commited remember... you can always delegate authority, but you can NEVER delegate responsability. his Auto Golpe was a measured act desighned to gain authoritative power over his people, and he exersized that authority with sanctions against the press.. under his rule freedom of press became threatened. Universities were redistributed to HIS pocket. he was so dangerous in the area, that Peru was ostracized form the OAS, and CHILE, ARGENTINA, and ECUADOR pulled their Ambassadors out... How about the detention and disappearance of the 67 students from Huancayo, and the disappearance of the residents from Chimbote? they all have names, and are all still missing... he has been found guilty and will spend the next 25 years in prison, ON TOP of his 6 years he was convicted to for corruption charges.

content: The point is, democracy versus terrorism, that´s all. A few days ago, soldiers were killed in Ayacucho emergency zone, what can you tell me about it? terrorism is still alive... and fighting...government reserves was full when Fujimori left the power...and MFI recognized that. why Elles say the contrary? Alan garcia stoled all the money.Never Argentina,Chile Ecuador left Peru falling down, That is false, why are you lying, Elles? where are you from? Are you a terrorist?..Maybe nobody knows but in peruvian jungle, war is a cruel reality and you know what? ong offices get officials and soldiers in trial.I mean, soldier John says his buddies..."... hey .wait for me, keep fighting, I have to go to declare to the court, I will be back soon..." that is because of the demands for suppose Abuse against the human rights of the terrorist, say anything Elleso...Fujimori changed the rules because peruvian politicians were blind men, they lived in clouds not on the earth so, the country never get up...Country was needing a change and Fujimori did it...ONGs office get money from the foreing countries but for terrorist legal defense and they are trying to disturb the war that the government is fighting, actually ,in the jungle and the highland;Actually,Peruvian Armed Forces are fighting while you are reading this forum...remember...only a blind man and the terrorists can say Fujimori stoled money, look at the country right now, is growing every day, Toledo continued the same economic line and Aln Garci does the same, you really think you can built a country in five years? if so, you are a magician that everybody woul like to have...Juanjo11...

Are you a terrorist?..Maybe nobody knows but in peruvian jungle, war is a cruel reality and you know what? ong offices get officials and soldiers in trial.I mean, soldier John says his buddies..."... hey .wait for me, keep fighting, I have to go to declare to the court, I will be back soon..." that is because of the demands for suppose Abuse against the human rights of the terrorist, say anything Elleso...Fujimori changed the rules because peruvian politicians were blind men, they lived in clouds not on the earth so, the country never get up...Country was needing a change and Fujimori did it...ONGs office get money from the foreing countries but for terrorist legal defense and they are trying to disturb the war that the government is fighting, actually ,in the jungle and the highland;Actually,Peruvian Armed Forces are fighting while you are reading this forum...remember...only a blind man and the terrorists can say Fujimori stoled money, look at the country right now, is growing every day, Toledo continued the same economic line and Aln Garci does the same, you really think you can built a country in five years? if so, you are a magician that everybody woul like to have...Juanjo11... i have been in the jungles of peru. i lived in Iquitos as a child (not making me an expert by any extent of the word) you ask where i am from... i am originary of the USA, but have lived all over the world. i lived in maracaibo, Venezuela, in Iquitos, in Mendoza Argentina. i Pretty much grew up in Mexico, i watched Alberto's rise to power as an adult. and i watched his fall from grace. the man got power, and became intoxicated with it. His head of intelligence was a filthy man. his actions reflected that of Alberto's needs. Montessino was a spy who was dishonorably discharged from the Peruvian Army. he spent time in prison for selling secrets to the USA. quote: Various states acted to condemn the coup individually. Venezuela broke off diplomatic relations, and Argentina withdrew its ambassador. Chile joined Argentina in requesting that Peru be suspended from the Organization of American States. International financiers delayed planned or projected loans, and the United States, Germany and Spain suspended all non-humanitarian aid to Peru. The coup appeared to threaten the economic recovery strategy of reinsertion, and complicated the process of clearing arrears with the International Monetary Fund. Whereas Peruvian-U.S. relations early in Fujimori's presidency had been dominated by questions of coca eradication, Fujimori's autogolpe immediately became a major obstacle to international relations, as the United States immediately suspended all military and economic aid to Peru, with exceptions for counter-narcotic and humanitarian-related funds. Two weeks after the self-coup, the George H.W. Bush administration changed its position and officially recognized Fujimori as the legitimate leader of Peru "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberto_Fujimori" i know this is wikkipedia, but it iwas a quick search. El Sendero luminoso has been resurging since the exodus of Fujimori. with one faction becomming a political organization (not unlike the PLO, or the IRA), and the other getting in bed with the FaRC in Colombia. remember, to you they are terrorists, to many in the jungles of Peru, they are "liberators" i guess it is just a matter of outlook.
